newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Morocco seizes 5.8 tonnes of cocaine.
newsitem.headline: Morocco seizes 5.8 tonnes of cocaine.

text.p: Morocco's security forces have seized up to 5.8 tonnes of pure cocaine which washed up on Moroccan shores, the official MAP news agency reported on Friday.
Quoting a statement by the interior ministry, MAP said ..."total drugs seized by security forces on the Atlantic coastline from Casablanca to El Jadida rose to 5.8 tonnes of pure cocaine".
The first cocaine was discovered last month by children playing on a Casablanca beach when they opened plastic bags and tasted the white powder inside, L'Opinion newspaper said earlier.
The total seized has a street value of more than $500 million, a Moroccan doctor said.
The drugs were smuggled from Colombia on a ship bound for southern Europe, MAP said.
It named the targeted area as "Spanish-Portugal zone".
The cocaine was thrown overboard after the ship, which had a Spanish captain, had a mechanical breakdown, it said.
MAP said Moroccan Interior Minister Driss Basri unexpectedly visited the southern Spanish city of Malaga on Friday for talks with Spanish officials.
"Basri started a working visit to Malaga where he met his Spanish counterpart, including the government delegate in charge of national anti-drugs plan," MAP said.
The minister was accompanied with senior officials from the Moroccan interior and security services, it said but gave no other details.
